definitions: a bacterium of a large group typically having simple cells with rigid cell walls and often flagella for movement. The group comprises the “true” bacteria and cyanobacteria, as distinct from archaebacteria.

notes.text: Kingdom Eubacteria; this group is sometimes taken to exclude nonrigid forms such as spirochetes and mycoplasmas

shortDefinitions: bacterium of large group having simple cells with rigid cell walls and often flagella for movement

definitions: a bacterium found mainly in the intestines of vertebrates and in the soil.

notes.text: Genus Eubacterium; Gram-positive, anaerobic, rod-shaped bacteria

shortDefinitions: bacterium found mainly in intestines of vertebrates and in soil
